articles.title: Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends
articles.description:
Not simply unplugged but reduced almost entirely to the bare bones, the performance could have just as easily been transported to Club Passim, whether now or six decades ago.

The post Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Natalie Merchant performed a stripped-down concert in support of Beverly's Grateful Friends on November 10.
The intimate performance style resembled past shows at Club Passim, appealing to local music enthusiasts.
Boston residents experienced a unique musical event that fosters community support for local causes.

articles.title: ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights
articles.description:
Many say the pedestrian-activated signals are confusing — and research shows most drivers don’t fully understand how they work.

The post ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Residents find hybrid traffic lights confusing, impacting pedestrian safety.
Research indicates over 70% of drivers misunderstand hybrid signal operations.
City officials may need to reassess traffic light designs for clarity.

articles.title: 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex
articles.description:
The apartment building housed mostly students, many of whom lost laptops, course materials, and personal belongings in the blaze.

The post 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: 230 UMass Amherst students were displaced due to a fire at an off-campus apartment complex.
The fire resulted in significant losses, including laptops and course materials for many students.
Local support services are mobilizing to assist affected students with housing and resources.

articles.title: Gabriela Coletta Zapata says she has secured Boston City Council presidency
articles.description:
Coletta Zapata has represented East Boston, Charlestown, and the North End on the City Council since 2022.

The post Gabriela Coletta Zapata says she has secured Boston City Council presidency appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Gabriela Coletta Zapata has secured the Boston City Council presidency as of November 2025.
Coletta Zapata has represented East Boston, Charlestown, and the North End since 2022.
Her presidency may influence local policies affecting residents in these neighborhoods.
